messages.title: The Lib Dems Are Winning
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats have continued to grow following their stunning success at the local and European elections in May. Recent polls show support for the Liberal Democrats is now at record levels and Jo Swinson is the most popular party leader. MPs from Labour and the Conservatives are joining the Lib Dems, fed up with the broken politics the two old parties represent.

messages.title: Demand Better For Britain
messages.content: Sign up here to support a Liberal Democrat government to deliver a brighter future for our country.

messages.title: We Have A Clear Choice
messages.content: The Conservatives want to force through a damaging Brexit that will wreck our economy and risk the end of the United Kingdom. Who knows where Jeremy Corbyn stands on Brexit? Labour now say they want to negotiate their own Brexit deal. A Liberal Democrat government led by Jo Swinson will stop Brexit on day one and get on with the job of improving people’s lives.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: The Liberal Democrats will build an economy that works for everyone.

issues.brexitEurope: The Conservatives want to force through a damaging Brexit that will wreck our economy and risk the end of the United Kingdom. Who knows where Jeremy Corbyn stands on Brexit? Labour now say they want to negotiate their own Brexit deal.
issues.economy: Recent polls show support for the Liberal Democrats is now at record levels. The Liberal Democrats will build an economy that works for everyone.

leaflet.personalStatement: Britain today is less fair than ever. People who work hard and play by the rules should be able to get on in life, but our failing politics means more and more people can't.

endorsements.endorsement: Jo Swinson will stop Brexit on day one and get on with the job of improving people’s lives.

Jo Swinson is the most popular party leader.

personalStories.story: Jo was Britain’s youngest MP when she defeated Labour to win her seat in 2005. As a Business Minister between 2012-2015, she successfully introduced shared parental leave and clamped down on unscrupulous payday loan lenders.

Who knows where Jeremy Corbyn stands on Brexit?
